alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills; South Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 01 at 8:36PM PST until December 03 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Much of southwest Washington and northwest Oregon, excluding the Cascades, the Hood River Valley and the Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...Through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers and streams, as well as low-lying and flood-prone locations. Smaller streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in areas of poor drainage, such as railroad crossings and underpasses. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A series of atmospheric rivers will bring periods of widespread heavy rain through early next week. Rain will be increasing on Saturday, with heavy rain likely Saturday night intto early Sunday. Total rain amounts through Sunday: 3 to 5 inches along the coast, 4 to 7 inches over the coastal mountains, 2 to 4 inches across the interior lowlands, and 4 to 7 inches of rain across the Cascades and western Columbia River Gorge. Localized heavy rain will lead to higher rain totals. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills; South Willamette Valley
